content: Ælfric's Grammar; Dialogue of Adrian and Ritheus, Distichs of Cato, etc.
summary: A composite manuscript made up of three units, which now contains six items. Part 1, item 1: fols 1-9, a fragment of Bede's De Temporibus, datable to s. ximed. Part 2, item 2: fols 10- 135, Ã†lfric's Grammar and Ã†lfric's Glossary, datable to s. ximed. Part 3, Item 3, fols 136-37, a prayer beginning 'Ã†la drihten leof. Ã¦la dema god' (Dobbie 1942, p. 94; Grein & WÃ¼lcker 1881-98, ii, p. 211). Lines 15-22 on fol. 137 are blank. Item 4, fols 137v-40, Dialogue of Adrian and Ritheus, beginning 'Adrianus cwÃ¦Ã° to Ritheus. Saga me hu lange wÃ¦s Adam on neorxnaÆ¿ange' (Kemble 1848, p. 198; FÃ¶rster 1897, p. 433). Lines 21-22 on fol. 140 are blank. Item 5, fol. 140v, notes on two thieves, Note on Noah's Ark, the church of St. Peter, the temple of Solomon, the world and the number of bones etc. in the human body, beginning 'Her sagaÃ° embe Ã¾a twegen sceÃ°an' (Napier 1889, p. 5; FÃ¶rster 1897, p. 433). Item 6, fols 141- 4v, a translation of some of the Distichs of Cato , beginning '[N]e beo Ã¾u to slapor. ne to idelgeorn' followed by some apophthegms that are independent of the Distichs (FÃ¶rster 1897, p. 342), ending imperfectly 'Ã¾Ã¦t Ã°e lycaÃ°' (Kemble 1848, p. 258). The four items in the third part are datable to s. xiimed.

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (136r/1) Æla drihten leof. æla dema god

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (137r/14) herian heofonas god. haligum reorde. á butan ende. amen

notes.head: Other versions of the text
notes.body: Also in London, Lambeth Palace 427, fol. 183v

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (137v/1) ADRIANVS cwæð to Ritheus. Saga me hu lange wæs Adam on neorxnawange

notes.head: Incipit
notes.body: (140v/1) Her sagað embe þa twegen sceðan

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (140v/21) Mana hafað bana twa hundred ˥ nigontine... þritti þusend daga ˥ six hundred

notes.head: Explicit
notes.body: (144v/22) Gyf ðu wylt habbe æt monigum men þæt ðe lycað

objectDesc.extent:
220 mm x 142 mm (dimensions of fols 2-9 - size of leaves).
198 mm x 100 mm (dimensions of fols 2-9 - size of written space).

history.provenance: Acquired by Sir Thomas Cotton, possibly in three unbound units whose content is catalogued on fol. 14r of London, British Library, Add. 36683. On loan to Henry Spelman around 1615 (London, British Library, Harley 6018, fol. 159r; See Doane 2007, p. 11).
history.acquisition: Acquired by the British Museum along with the rest of the Cotton collection .

admin: Manuscript described by Orietta Da Rold with the assistance of Hollie Morgan, Owen Roberson and George Younge (2012).
